intro: Uragoga phyllocalymma, commonly known as the narrow-leafed uragoga, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows from a short, thick stem and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are narrow and fleshy, adapted to store water in its native dry environment. Uragoga phyllocalymma is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xerophytic gardens.
